description: Estimate of eastward equatorial electric field component, by using magnetic measurements of the equatorial electrojet (EEJ) current as the satellites fly overhead. Since the magnetic signal of the EEJ current is directly measured by the satellite, this product also provides an estimate of the EEJ current strength.
variables_table:
Variable,Units,Description,Dim,Type
Timestamp,-,"Time of satellite crossing of the magnetic equator, UTC",1,CDF_EPOCH
Longitude,degrees,Geographic longitude of satellite crossing of the magnetic equator,1,CDF_REAL8
Latitude,degrees,Geographic latitude of satellite crossing of the magnetic equator,1,CDF_REAL8
EEF,mV/m,Estimate of the equatorial electric field,1,CDF_REAL8
EEJ_meast,A/km,"Height-integrated magnetic eastward current profile, spanning [-20:0.5:20] degrees QD latitude",81,CDF_REAL8
EEJ_mnorth,A/km,"Height-integrated magnetic northward current profile, spanning [-20:0.5:20] degrees QD latitude",81,CDF_REAL8
RelErr,-,Quality indicator of EEF estimate; relative error between modeled and observed current profile,1,CDF_REAL8
Flags,-,Flags describing data gaps and satellite identification,1,CDF_UINT2
Timestamp_Track,-,"Timestamps along track, length provided in Length_Track",3000,CDF_EPOCH
Latitude_Track,degrees,"Latitudes along track, length provided in Length_Track",3000,CDF_REAL8
Longitude_Track,degress,"Longitudes along track, length provided in Length_Track",3000,CDF_REAL8
Radius_Track,km,"Geocentric radii along track, length provided in Length_Track",3000,CDF_REAL8
Ksq_Track,A/km,"Surface current of estimated Sq signal, packed in geocentric north,east components,, length 2*Length_Track",6000,CDF_REAL8
Keej_Track,A/km,"Surface current of estimated EEJ signal, packed in geocentric north,east components,, length 2*Length_Track",6000,CDF_REAL8
Length_Track,-,Array of track lengths,1,CDF_UINT4
details:
Product Identifier EEFxTMS_2F
Definition Dayside equatorial electric field
Input Data MCO_SHA_2X, AUX_LIT_2, AUX_IGR_2
Input Time Span Every dayside equator crossing ±20 minutes
Spatial Representation One longitude/latitude pair (on the magnetic equator) for each output value
Time Representation Single values at time of dayside equator crossing
Units mV/m
Resolution 0.1 mV/m
Uncertainty 0.1 mV/m
Quality Indicator Relative error between modeled and observed current profile
Data Volume < 10 MB
Output Data CDF file with time series
Output Time Span Continuous for entire mission. One value for each day-side equator crossing (90 minute sampling for day-night local time orbits, 45 minutes for dawn-dusk orbits)
Update Rate One output file per day
Latency 30 hours
Notes The EEJ_meast and EEJ_mnorth vectors have length 81 and correspond to quasi-dipole (QD) latitudes ranging from -20° to +20° in steps of 0.5°. So for example, the corresponding QD latitude vector could be constructed using the following MATLAB syntax: qdvec = [-20:0.5:20]. The EEJ_meast profile is the projection of the EEJ current along the QD F1 basis vector. The EEJ_mnorth profile is the projection of the EEJ current along the QD F2 basis vector.
The variables with suffix _Track have variable lengths depending upon the value in Length_Track

Version 0502

Latitude              CDF_REAL8/1       0:[]    T/

Flags                 CDF_UINT2/1       0:[]    T/

RelErr                CDF_REAL8/1       0:[]    T/  
Flags                 CDF_UINT2/1       0:[]    T/
